ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I was able to improve my fluency in the language through current event and issues that affect Brazilian society and the broader world.
So many! I really improved my Portuguese and learned a ton about Brazilian culture.
My Portuguese speaking and comprehension
Brazilian culture
Portuguese conversational + listening skills, more about Brazilian culture- specifically about politics and native groups
I learned how to speak Portuguese.

This course has taught me so much about Brazilian culture, in addition to enhancing my understanding of Portuguese. We learned about Indigenous people in Brazil, Brazilian art history, the history and current politics of Brazil, and more! I also became much more confident in my speaking abilities.

Not only did I improve at speaking and understanding the Portuguese language, but I learned a lot more about Brazilian culture. I was able to think critically about cultural issues and events in Brazil and I can use these techniques for the rest of the world. I gained a greater appreciation for Brazilian culture.
intermediate Portuguese knowledge
The class helped me develop my vocabulary and taught me more about grammar. Through it, I also learned more about Brazilian art and about climate issues in Brazil and around the world.

Improved my vocabulary, grammar, speaking, reading, and writing skills throughout the class. Got exposed to lots of Brazilian culture, which opened my eyes to the diversity and complexity of Brazilian society.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The main strengths of this course was the diversity in perspectives across different literatures, as well as the opportunity to be taught by someone who understands current issues of Brazilian society.
this course was very good
In-class work was great.
Strengths was the professor
More asynchronous days or move the one asynchronous day to Friday

The main strength of this course is definitely the incredible professor: Thais. She has a passion for teaching that shines through in every lesson and makes us genuinely excited to learn and come to class every day. She also designed the course content in a way that was very engaging, with a variety of source material (articles, novels, documentaries, and music videos). There are truly no weaknesses of this course. I loved this course and cannot wait to continue with PORT 140 with Thais.

This course made learning Portuguese very enjoyable and with the asynchronous classes I was able to indulge into the Portuguese language at my own pace and in my own personal environment. I am not sure if this is a strength or a weakness, but compared to high school languages you are taught less about grammar and more about culture, but also more applicable discussion topics in real world scenarios - personally, I like this about the structure of the course.
I liked the professor and in class discussions
The strengths are that it immersed students in multiple aspects of Brazilian culture and teaches students more about Portuguese grammar.

Strengths: relaxed format, flexible, lot of engagement with culture
Weaknesses: not the most engaging at times because of how chill Thais was

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely! This course will expand your fluency in the language and make you more aware of Brazilian society and its needs today.
YES!
Yes
Highly recommend to anyone needing the language trio
Yes, I think its a great language to learn

I would absolutely recommend this course to any student who is considering enrolling in Portuguese. The professors are absolutely incredible and the course is designed in a way to facilitate learning without excessive stress. I have loved every second of this course and cannot recommend it enough!!
Absolutely. It is a beautiful language and the materials in the course is very interesting. It is a great language for someone to learn if they want to try something new.
Yes! Brazilian culture is super interesting.
very much so
Yes, the Portuguese department does a great job of creating an interesting curriculum that pushes students to engage with the language, culture, and history.
I would definitely recommend this course. It really helps students understand more about Portuguese grammar and more about Brazilian culture.
Yes, definitely! Great class that is fun and a refuge from other more difficult classes!
